data.name: Min-Width Detection
data.description:
In this kata you have to detect the correct item configured within a CSS3 media query-like configuration.
See [Using media queries](https://developer.mozilla.org/de/docs/Web/CSS/Media_Queries/Using_media_queries) for further informations.

The function `detectItem(config, width)` takes a configuration (array of objects) as first parameter and the given width (number) as second parameter. 

The correct output is the detected `item` value or `0` if no query fits for the given width. 

```javascript
// simple configuration
const config = [
  { item: 1, min: 100 }, // like @media (min-width: 100px) { ... }
  { item: 2, min: 300 }, // like @media (min-width: 300px) { ... }
  { item: 3, min: 600 }  // like @media (min-width: 600px) { ... }
];
```
The configuration objects property `item` is a simple unique identifier and always > 0. The `min` property is a positive integer value. 

The config above has following correct outputs:
* `<99` => 0
* `100 - 299` => 1
* `300 - 599` => 2
* `>600` => 3


## Additional informations
* Configuration migth be an empty array
* Configuration object always has an `item` and `min` property
* The `width` parameter might be an integer or float number value
